21  """A class that does terminology matching""" 
22   

23 -class TerminologyComparer: 

24 -    def __init__(self, max_len=500): 

25          self.match_info = {} 
26          self.MAX_LEN = max_len 

27   

28 -    def similarity(self, text, term, stoppercentage=40): 

29          """Returns the match quality of C{term} in the C{text}""" 
30          # We could segment the words, but mostly it will give less ideal 
31          # results, since we'll miss plurals, etc. Then we also can't search for 
32          # multiword terms, such as "Free Software". Ideally we should use a 
33          # stemmer, like the Porter stemmer. 
34   
35          # So we just see if the word occurs anywhere. This is not perfect since 
36          # we might get more than we bargained for. The term "form" will be found 
37          # in the word "format", for example. A word like "at" will trigger too 
38          # many false positives. 
39   
40          text = text[:self.MAX_LEN] 
41   
42          pos = text.find(term) 
43          if pos >= 0: 
44              self.match_info[term] = { 'pos': pos } 
45              return 100 
46          return 0 

47
